title: Piers Morgan mocks Greta Thunberg as she loses out on Nobel Peace Prize
text:
Piers isn’t Greta’s biggest fan (Picture: REX, EPA)

Greta Thunberg didn’t win the Nobel Peace Prize, but that doesn’t mean Piers Morgan doesn’t have anything to say about the matter.

The Good Morning Britain host seemingly mocked the teenage activist after the Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.

He was awarded the 2019 prize for his efforts to ‘achieve peace and international cooperation’ through his peace deal with Eritrea.

Greta, 16, was the favourite to win the Prize, and Piers – who has not been too keen on the teenager’s battling against climate change – addressed her losing out on Twitter.

The 54-year-old wrote: ‘How DARE they actually give it to someone who forged peace?!!!!’

Piers was baffled by the idea that Greta could win the Nobel Peace Prize, previously tweeting: ‘What’s she done for peace, exactly?

‘She’s got just very, very angry about climate change, abused loads of adults & terrified millions of children.’

Speaking about her now iconic speech at the United Nations, Piers claimed that while the Swede is impressive, he finds the way she is going about raising climate change awareness ‘melodramatic’.

He said on Good Morning Britain: ‘She’s highly impressive, a 16-year-old girl who is so articulate, so passionate, I’ve got no problem with that and climate change is a very serious issue, I get it all.

Abiy Ahmed won the Nobel Peace Prize (Picture: Christian Minelli/NurPhoto)

‘There’s something I felt very uncomfortable watching it yesterday. It was all a bit melodramatic, end of the world, apocalyptic. I wonder the impact she’s now having on young people around the world watching this who must be thinking, “Oh my god, the world is literally about to end.” It’s not about to end.

‘I don’t want millions, if not billions, of young people watching Greta do that kind of speech and genuinely think the planet is literally about to end, because it isn’t. So climate change is serious, it should be dealt with, it’s an important issue, but it’s not end of the world stuff in the way she’s portraying it, in my opinion.’

Piers isn’t the only TV star who has taken issue with Ms Thunberg, with Jeremy Clarkson branding her a ‘spoilt brat’.

However, the majority of people are hailing Greta as the most influential teenager on the world stage, thanks to her relentless campaigning for environmental issues.
